Field Label: ## Oppositional Defiant Disorder

### Symptoms\r\n\r\nEarlier you told me that you do things that might get you into trouble, like talking back to parents/teachers or losing your temper. I am now going to ask you some questions about that.
### Loses Temper\r\n\r\nDid you often lose your temper, scream and yell at people, or break things when you got angry?
### Argues with Adults\r\n\r\nDid you argue with or talk back to your parents more often than your friends did?
Did you argue with or talk back to your teachers more often than your classmates did?
### Defies Adults or Rules\r\n\r\nDid you often refuse to do what your parents or teachers asked you to do, for example chores or tasks at school?
Did you often get into trouble for breaking rules at home or school?
### Deliberately Annoys other People\r\n\r\nDid you often do things on purpose to bother or annoy other people? (code no if only with sibling)
### Blames Others for Mistakes\r\n\r\nDid you often blame other people for your mistakes? (code no if only with sibling)
### Irritable or Easily Annoyed\r\n\r\nWere you often irritable or grouchy?
Would other people often annoy you or make you angry?
### Angry/Resentful\r\n\r\nHave you often gotten angry because you thought things were unfair?

### Spiteful/Vindictive\r\n\r\nHave you often tried to get back at people or get even with them by doing things like hurting them, messing up their things, or telling lies about them?  (code no if only with sibling)
### Swears or Uses Obscene Language\r\n\r\nDid you often get into trouble for swearing or using bad language?
_INTERVIEWER: The participant did not endorse any behaviors. End **Oppositional Defiant Disorder** Section._

Field Label: Did you do these behaviors: \r\n\r\n With your parents?
With your teachers?
With other adults?
How often did you (behaviors)?  Was it: nearly every day, a few days a week, about once a week, or less than once a week?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Nearly every day | 2, A few days a week | 3, About once a week | 4, Less than once a week | 9, Unknown

Field Label: Did you do these behaviors for at least six months or more?

### Distress/Impairment

Please look at Participant Card 8: Distress/Impairment. 

 _INTERVIEWER: Remind child how to use scale, if necessary._
### Distress\r\n\r\nHow much did having these behaviors upset or bother you?

### Impairment: Family

How much did these behaviors change your relationships with your family?  

 Probe: Did your family say something about this to you?  Did family members seem upset, angry, or annoyed with you because of your behavior?

### Impairment: Social

How much did these behaviors change your relationships with your friends?  

 Probe: Did you find yourself spending much less time than usual with your friends?  Did your friends say something about your behavior?
### Impairment: School\r\n\r\nHow much did these behaviors change your relationships with your teachers or classmates?  -change how well you did at school, on tests, homework, or grades?
Did you stay home or were you sent home from school because of your behavior?
How many days of school did you miss because of your difficulties with attention or overactivity? (lifetime)
### Impairment: Global\r\n\r\n_INTERVIEWER: What number describes how impaired the participant was during the episode?_

### Episodes: Onset

How old were you the **first time** you had these (list behaviors)? 

 _Code 998 if "always", 999 if "unknown"._
### Episodes: Offset\r\n\r\nDo you still (list behaviors)?
How old were you the **last time** you did this behavior? \r\n\r\n _Code 998 if "always", 999 if "unknown"._
### Episodes: Course\r\n\r\nSince you were (age of onset), was there ever a time when you did not (insert behavior)?
What was the longest period of time that you did not do (list behavior)? \r\n\r\n _(N weeks, N months, N years)_

Did you ever go to see a doctor, nurse, psychologist, social worker, school counselor, minister/priest or other professional to get help for (list behaviors)?
